metadata.questionText: \text{For } x^3 + y^3 = 6xy,\\[0.5em]\text{what is the first step to find } \frac{dy}{dx}?
metadata.correctAnswer: \text{Differentiate both sides with respect to x}
allOptions: Differentiate both sides with respect to x
metadata.explanation: First step: differentiate both sides with respect to x. For x³ + y³ = 6xy, get: 3x² + 3y²(dy/dx) = 6y + 6x(dy/dx). Then collect dy/dx terms and solve.
